item.title: The 25 Most Notable Movies of 2025: ‘KPop Demon Hunters,’ ‘Roofman’ and More
item.description: We polled film experts in the newsroom. These are the titles that stuck with us this year.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times
item.category: Come See Me in the Good Light (Movie)
If I Had Legs I'd Kick You (Movie)

item.title: ‘Avatar: Fire and Ash’ Review: By Land, by Water, by Air!
item.description: For the franchise’s third movie, James Cameron throws in new creatures, new landscapes, melodramatic plot lines and big battle sequences. It’s a lot.
item.dc:creator: Manohla Dargis

item.title: ‘Avatar: Fire and Ash’: What to Remember Before Seeing the New Movie
item.description: The newest chapter in the saga of the Na’vi people continues to build their highly detailed world. Here’s a guide to catch you up on the developments.
item.dc:creator: Esther Zuckerman

item.title: ‘The Housemaid’ Review: Sydney Sweeney and Amanda Seyfried Lead Twisty Thriller
item.description: Sydney Sweeney and Amanda Seyfried star in a thriller that is best seen with a full house.
item.dc:creator: Alissa Wilkinson

item.title: ‘Cover-Up’ Review: Seymour Hersh, Scoops and Power
item.description: In their documentary, Laura Poitras (“Citizenfour”) and Mark Obenhaus trace the career highs and lows of the famed investigative journalist.
item.dc:creator: Manohla Dargis

item.title: ‘Is This Thing On?’ Review: When a Punchline Becomes a Lifeline
item.description: Will Arnett and Laura Dern add emotional heft to Bradley Cooper’s intimate comedy about a separated spouse who finds solace in stand-up.
item.dc:creator: Jeannette Catsoulis

item.title: ‘Breakdown: 1975’ Remembers the Cinematic Voices of an Era
item.description: This documentary could be better, but it offers a helpful lesson for film fans new to the movies of that decade.
item.dc:creator: Alissa Wilkinson

item.title: ‘Sorry, Baby,’ ‘Lurker’ and the Year’s Great Under-the-Radar Streaming Films
item.description: Here are just a few of the year’s finest indies, documentaries and international selections, available to stream at this very minute.
item.dc:creator: Jason Bailey

item.title: What We Know About Rob Reiner’s Final Projects
item.description: The release of a “Spinal Tap” concert film that was filmed at Stonehenge has been delayed.
item.dc:creator: Maya Salam
item.category: Spinal Tap at Stonehenge: The Final Finale (Movie)

item.title: Theodor Pistek, 93, Oscar-Winning ‘Amadeus’ Costume Designer, Dies
item.description: A busy designer who worked on over 100 films, he was also a racecar driver and a painter of photorealistic works, many depicting cars and their operators.
item.dc:creator: Michael S. Rosenwald
item.media:description: Tom Hulce, center, played Mozart in Milos Forman’s popular 1984 film “Amadeus.” Mr. Pistek won an Academy Award for the costumes.

item.title: Carrie Coon and Tracy Letts Want to Get Under Your Skin
item.description: The couple are gearing up for the Broadway opening of “Bug,” about a descent into paranoia and psychosis in a squalid motel room.
item.dc:creator: Ben Brantley
item.media:credit: Caroline Tompkins for The New York Times

item.title: Five Science Fiction Movies to Stream Now
item.description: In this month’s picks, torrents, trolls and time travel.
item.dc:creator: Elisabeth Vincentelli

item.title: Five Free Movies to Stream
item.description: The final column of the year looks at the end of things — the end of the world, the end of youth — along with an underrated holiday gem.
item.dc:creator: Brandon Yu

item.title: 6 New Movies Our Critics Are Talking About This Week
item.description: Whether you’re a casual moviegoer or an avid buff, our reviewers think these films are worth knowing about.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times
item.category: The SpongeBob Movie: Search for SquarePants (Movie)

item.title: After Rob Reiner’s ‘North’ Flopped, He Proved He Could Take Criticism With Humor
item.description: Roger Ebert said he “hated, hated, hated, hated, hated” Reiner’s 1994 film “North.” The director took it in stride.
item.dc:creator: Victor Mather
item.media:description: Rob Reiner on the set of “North” in 1994. The movie was released on the heels of several hit movies he had directed.

item.title: ‘The SpongeBob Movie: Search for SquarePants’ Review: Underwater Adventure
item.description: The latest installment to this entertainment juggernaut relies on a cheap, rote formula and easy gags to keep children engaged.
item.dc:creator: Brandon Yu
item.category: The SpongeBob Movie: Search for SquarePants (Movie)

item.title: ‘David’ Review: Preaching to the Choir
item.description: The story of David and Goliath is presented as a feel-good family epic in this animated musical released by the popular religious media company Angel Studios.
item.dc:creator: Calum Marsh

item.title: ‘Counting Crows: Have You Seen Me Lately?’ Review: Becoming Big Stars
item.description: The band became a major success in 1993 with the hit “Mr. Jones.” Since then, the group has done its best to keep rock music alive.
item.dc:creator: Glenn Kenny
item.category: Counting Crows: Have You Seen Me Lately? (Movie)

item.title: Christine Choy, Documentarian of Asian American Life, Dies at 76
item.description: Her film “Who Killed Vincent Chin?” earned an Oscar nomination in 1988 and was inducted into the National Film Registry for its cultural significance.
item.dc:creator: Ash Wu

item.title: Timothée Chalamet, Gwyneth Paltrow and Zohran Mamdani Toast ‘Marty Supreme’
item.description: With orange beanies, a roast pig and a mayor-elect, the New York premiere of A24’s buzzy Ping-Pong film was its own kind of flick.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Bahr and Nina Westervelt
item.media:credit: Nina Westervelt for The New York Times

item.title: Oscars Reach Deal With YouTube
item.description: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences said it had reached a deal with YouTube for exclusive rights to the show starting in 2029.
item.dc:creator: Brooks Barnes and John Koblin
item.category: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences
item.media:credit: Philip Cheung for The New York Times
item.media:description: Conan O’Brien hosting the 97th Academy Awards in March.

item.title: ‘The Voice of Hind Rajab’ Review: When Help Won’t Arrive
item.description: Kaouther Ben Hania’s dramatized feature about a Palestinian girl who is killed in Gaza City is both powerfully direct and purposefully removed.
item.dc:creator: Ben Kenigsberg

item.title: The Most Notable Movies of 2025
item.description: Across the newsroom, journalists picked their most notable movies from 2025.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Goodman, Kyle Buchanan, Joe Coscarelli, Reggie Ugwu, Amanda Webster, Edward Vega and Laura Salaberry

item.title: How Rob Reiner Created His Comedy Legacy
item.description: These moments from his movies brought the laughs, in many different ways.
item.dc:creator: Jason Zinoman

item.title: Billy Crystal, Meg Ryan and Others Remember Rob Reiner as a ‘Master Story Teller’
item.description: A group of prominent figures issued a statement memorializing Mr. Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer Reiner. “We were their friends, and we will miss them forever.”
item.dc:creator: Ali Watkins
item.media:description: Rob Reiner, left, with Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan during an anniversary screening of “When Harry Met Sally” in 2019.

item.title: Will the Oscars Make Room for ‘Difficult’ Women for 2026’s Best Actress Category?
item.description: Rose Byrne, Jennifer Lawrence and Amanda Seyfried give great performances as women who buck convention. But some voters prize ‘likability’ above all else.
item.dc:creator: Kyle Buchanan
item.category: If I Had Legs I'd Kick You (Movie)

item.title: Why Do Movies Keep Repeating the Same Joke About the Afterlife?
item.description: From the recent ‘Eternity’ to classics like ‘Defending Your Life’ and ‘Beetlejuice,’ the gag remains the same: What if the next world worked just like this one?
item.dc:creator: Scout Brobst

item.title: ‘Who Killed Santa Claus?’: The Night Before Christmas in Occupied France
item.description: This 1941 comic murder mystery is back for a week in a sparkling restoration at Film Forum.
item.dc:creator: J. Hoberman
item.media:description: Raymond Rouleau, left, and Renée Faure in “Who Killed Santa Claus?”

item.title: What We Know About Nick Reiner, Charged With Killing Rob and Michele Reiner
item.description: The son of Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner, who has been charged with two counts of first-degree murder, has long struggled with drug addiction.
item.dc:creator: Derrick Bryson Taylor
item.media:description: Rob Reiner’s star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame on Monday.

item.title: Oscar Shortlists: ‘Sinners,’ ‘One Battle After Another’ and ‘Wicked: for Good’ Lead
item.description: The lineups, which Oscar voters will choose from next month, include the new casting category, which was largely a dress rehearsal for best picture.
item.dc:creator: Kyle Buchanan

item.title: Rob Reiner Gave Us Great Reasons to Go to the Movies
item.description: “This Is Spinal Tap,” “When Harry Met Sally …,” “Misery”: Reiner delivered an incredible number of accessible, original and adult movies that we still cherish.
item.dc:creator: Manohla Dargis
item.category: Spinal Tap II: The End Continues (Movie)
item.media:description: The director Rob Reiner, in 1989, on the set of “When Harry Met Sally …”

item.title: ‘Beaches’ Was a Novel. Then a Movie. Next, It’ll Be a Broadway Musical.
item.description: A musical adaptation of the story will open at the Majestic Theater next spring. And yes, the score includes “Wind Beneath My Wings.”
item.dc:creator: Michael Paulson
item.media:description: Jessica Vosk, left, and Kelli Barrett starred in a production of “Beaches” last year at Theater Calgary in Canada, and will do so again next year on Broadway.

item.title: Who Is the Ultimate Onscreen Mr. Darcy From ‘Pride and Prejudice’?
item.description: Welcome to our Regency Thunderdome, where we will endeavor to answer this question once and for all.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Harlan, Sarah Lyall and Sadie Stein

item.title: The Best True Crime of 2025: ‘Predators” and More
item.description: Here are four highlights across TV, film and podcasting from the second half of the year.
item.dc:creator: Maya Salam
item.category: The Twisted Tale of Amanda Knox (TV Program)

item.title: Nick Reiner’s Struggles With Drugs Left His Parents ‘Desperate’
item.description: Mr. Reiner, who was arrested in connection with the deaths of Rob and Michele Reiner, once estimated he had been in drug treatment 18 times as a teenager.
item.dc:creator: Julia Jacobs and Nicole Sperling

item.title: Rob Reiner Made Clear What He Believed In, Onscreen and Off
item.description: In films like “A Few Good Men,” the director’s ideas of honor and morality were stated as plainly as could be.
item.dc:creator: Alissa Wilkinson

item.title: Rob Reiner: A Life in Pictures
item.description: The actor-turned-director spent decades at the forefront of the entertainment world.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

item.title: As Michael Stivic in ‘All in the Family,’ Rob Reiner Brought Political Arguments Home
item.description: Reiner’s “All in the Family” role didn’t just capture the arguments of its time. It gave us a preview of our own.
item.dc:creator: James Poniewozik

item.title: Rob Reiner’s Movies and TV Shows: ‘When Harry Met Sally,’ ‘The Princess Bride’ and More
item.description: He played one of the most memorable sitcom roles of the ’70s before going on to direct a string of enduring movie classics. Here are some of his career highlights.
item.dc:creator: Esther Zuckerman
item.media:description: Rob Reiner on the set of “Stand By Me.”

item.title: The Berlin Film Festival Moves Forward Despite Challenges
item.description: The festival, which takes place in winter and late in the award season, has, in recent years, been somewhat overshadowed by its sister events in Cannes and Venice.
item.dc:creator: Farah Nayeri
item.media:description: The actress Fan Bingbing posing at the 75th Berlin International Film Festival in February. Over the years, the festival has been disadvantaged by its timing in the calendar.

item.title: Renate Reinsve of ‘Sentimental Value’, Talks Levity, Joachim Trier and Quantum Physics
item.description: “I would feel deflated if I couldn’t go into something deeply existential and explore,” said the Norwegian actress, who stars in the Oscar-buzzy “Sentimental Value.”
item.dc:creator: Stefano Montali
item.media:description: A scene from “Sentimental Value,” with Reinsve and Inga Ibsdotter Lilleaas.

item.title: ‘The Emperor’s New Groove’ at 25: Kronk’s Enduring Appeal
item.description: This millennial favorite wouldn’t be the same without a certain sidekick.
item.dc:creator: Carlos Aguilar

item.title: ‘A Christmas Carol’, ‘Dead Outlaw’ and More Theater to Stream
item.description: Other picks include a family production of “The Snow Queen,” the Broadway-bound “Every Brilliant Thing” and the acclaimed comedy “Sorry for Your Loss.”
item.dc:creator: Rachel Sherman

item.title: Olivia Dean, Josh Johnson and Chase Infiniti Are Among Our 2025 Breakout Stars
item.description: Across the arts, these 10 performers took a leap of faith this year and stuck the landing in a big way.
item.dc:creator: Maya Salam

item.title: Rob Reiner’s Younger Son Charged With Murder: What We Know
item.description: Nick Reiner has been charged with two counts of first-degree murder in the killing of his parents.
item.dc:creator: Jin Yu Young and Mark Walker
item.media:description: Police officers outside the home of Rob Reiner in the Brentwood neighborhood of Los Angeles on Sunday night.

item.title: Rob Reiner, Actor Who Went on to Direct Classic Films, Dies at 78
item.description: After finding fame in “All in the Family,” he directed winning films like “This Is Spinal Tap,” “When Harry Met Sally … ” and “The Princess Bride” and got involved in liberal politics.
item.dc:creator: Julia Jacobs and Clay Risen
item.media:description: Rob Reiner in Los Angeles in 1986.

item.title: ‘Anna Christie’ Review: Michelle Williams on the Waterfront
item.description: The actress stars in Thomas Kail’s luminous revival of Eugene O’Neill’s play about a woman whose past threatens her future.
item.dc:creator: Laura Collins-Hughes
item.media:description: Michelle Williams in the 1921 drama “Anna Christie” at St. Ann’s Warehouse in Brooklyn.

item.title: James Cameron Tempers His Temper and Channels His Inner Na’vi
item.description: Years after his Titanic tantrums, the “Avatar” director has “mellowed,” says Sigourney Weaver. He calls it “marinating.”
item.dc:creator: Maureen Dowd
item.media:credit: JJ Geiger for The New York Times

item.title: Confirm or Deny: James Cameron Edition
item.description: The box office king sits for a lightning-round interview.
item.dc:creator: Maureen Dowd
item.media:credit: JJ Geiger for The New York Times
item.media:description: He has an explanation for his “King of the World” statement.

item.title: Tom Hanks on the Electrifying (and Terrifying) Experience of Writing a Play
item.description: The actor also stars in the Off Broadway production of “This World of Tomorrow,” a yearslong project at the Shed through Dec. 21.
item.dc:creator: Tom Hanks and Thomas Prior
item.media:credit: Thomas Prior for The New York Times
item.media:description: Tom Hanks plays a tech entrepreneur from 2089 who travels back to the 1939 World’s Fair. He said he wanted to explore “lives caught between the certainties of our past and the unknowable future.”

item.title: Peter Greene, ‘Pulp Fiction’ and ‘The Mask’ Actor, Dies at 60
item.description: Mr. Greene, who built a four-decade career uncannily portraying villains, was found dead in his apartment in Manhattan on Friday, his manager said.
item.dc:creator: Derrick Bryson Taylor
item.media:credit: Desiree Navarro/Everett Collection, via Alamy Stock Photo
item.media:description: Peter Greene in New York in 2010. The New York Times once called his work “scarily authentic.”

item.title: The Year Hollywood Finally Confronted Our Political Moment
item.description: In movies like “Eddington,” “Sinners,” “Wake Up Dead Man” and others, filmmakers have at last wrapped their heads around how to explain this period.
item.dc:creator: Alissa Wilkinson
item.category: Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery (Movie)

item.title: 41 Things That Stuck With Us in 2025
item.description: Aunt Gladys. Tyler, the Creator. That sex scene in “The Naked Gun.” These are the things Culture staffers couldn’t stop thinking about this year.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times
item.category: The Real Housewives of Orange County (TV Program)
item.media:credit: Neon; Sara Krulwich/The New York Times; Daniel Arnold, via Loose Joints; Warner Bros.
